## How is GPS changing the world?

::: {.incremental}

- In 2008, only 8% of US used GPS on Mobile Phones
- From 2010 to 2014, GPS production went from 500 million to 1.1 Billion
- By 2014, 81% had adopted Mapping Apps
- By 2022, over 7 billion GPS chips were manufactured!

:::

## ArcGIS Field Maps

Step 2: Create a map on ArcGIS Field Maps Designer<br>
<https://www.arcgis.com/apps/fieldmaps/>

- Sign in with our ArcGIS Organization's URL: `umontana.maps.arcgis.com`
- Follow with you UM NetID credentials
- Select **+ New Map** to start a new map
- Build layers first, then configure forms
  
## ArcGIS Field Maps

Step 3: Access your map from the Field Maps app, and start collecting data!

- Sign in with our ArcGIS Organization's URL: `umontana.maps.arcgis.com`
- Your maps should appear in your app (pull down to refresh)
  
## My Griz Life
Your family and/or non-Griz friends miss you!<br>Create a map that shares what you enjoy about the University of Montana Campus.

1. Create a map in Field Maps Designer titled "My Griz Life"

## My Griz Life

2. Create a layer to map out your activities around campus
  - Develop a simple form 
  - Consider using a **Choice** field (*Combo Box* or *Radio Buttons*) for different types of activities (e.g., Academics, Extracurriculars, Food)
  
## My Griz Life

3. Start collecting data!
  - Consider adding photos or other attachments to help illustrate your life
  - **Be mindful of content!**<br>Please don't share anything you wouldn't want your grandmother (or me, or others) to see
